title: Online Language Learning Environment Design: Enhancing Learner Autonomy Through Task-Based Instruction and Web 2.0 Technologies

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental digital tool proficiency and intermediate or higher foreign language skills
context.additional_context: Learners complete assignments and engage in peer feedback activities via an online platform, with weekly offline sessions for instructor interaction and comprehensive feedback.

learning_goals: Learners can autonomously generate linguistic content using task-based activities and Web 2.0 tools
Learners can self-directively set and execute learning goals through structured and open-ended tasks
Learners can actively participate in language learning processes through social interactions with peers and instructors

resources: Access to Web 2.0 tools (e.g., Google Docs, Padlet, Flipgrid)
Online assignment submission and feedback system (LMS)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
